title: 113_hr3970
content: The Act titled "Stop Subsidizing Multimillion Dollar Corporate Bonuses Act" expands the denial of deduction for excessive employee remuneration. The Act "Stop Subsidizing Multimillion Dollar Corporate Bonuses Act" expands the denial of deduction for excessive employee remuneration by amending Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to redefine "covered employee" as "covered individual" and specify that it includes officers, directors, and employees of the taxpayer or former officers, directors, or employees. The Act expands the denial of deduction for excessive employee remuneration by amending Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code to include officers, directors, and employees of the taxpayer. Amendments are made to Sections 48D(b)(3)(A) and 409A(b)(3)(D)(ii) of the Code for taxable years before January 1, 2014. Commission-based pay exception is eliminated in the expansion of applicable employee remuneration.
